note_content:
Session Note - March 12, 2026
Patient: Elena Rodriguez
Therapist: Dr. Amanda Foster, PhD

Presenting Concerns:
Patient presents with trauma-related symptoms following a motor vehicle accident eight months ago. Severity is moderate. Reports intrusive memories, hypervigilance in traffic, and avoidance of driving. These concerns are ongoing, not new this session. Triggers include loud noises and being a passenger in vehicles.

Session Summary:
In-person session focused on EMDR processing of the accident memory. Completed bilateral stimulation targeting the moment of impact. Patient demonstrated strong emotional processing with visible distress during reprocessing that resolved by end of set. SUD rating decreased from 7 to 3 during session. Patient reported feeling lighter after processing.

Mood Assessment:
Current mood: 5/10 (tense but relieved after processing)
Mood change from last session: Improved
Energy level: Normal
Emotional themes: fear, relief, cautious optimism
Affect observed: Anxious initially, shifting to calmer presentation
Affect congruence: Congruent

Mental Status Examination:
Appearance: Well-groomed
Behavior: Initially restless, became calmer during session
Speech: Normal
Thought process: Linear
Thought content: Trauma memories, safety concerns while driving
Perception: Reports occasional flashbacks of accident, no hallucinations
Cognition: Intact
Insight: Good - understands connection between trauma and current symptoms
Judgment: Good

Risk Assessment:
Suicidal ideation: None. Self-harm: None. Homicidal ideation: None. Risk level: Low.

Interventions Used:
- EMDR bilateral stimulation
- Grounding techniques
- Psychoeducation about trauma processing
Techniques were effective - SUD decreased significantly during session.
Skills taught: Container visualization for managing distressing memories between sessions
Skills practiced: Grounding techniques, safe place visualization
Homework assigned: Practice container exercise daily and note any intrusive memories in trauma log
Previous homework: Completed - practiced grounding exercises as assigned
Medications: Not applicable

Diagnoses:
Primary diagnosis: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
Primary diagnosis code: F43.10
Diagnosis status: No change

Treatment Progress:
Overall progress: Some improvement - SUD ratings decreasing across sessions
Treatment phase: Middle
Barriers: Avoidance of driving continues outside of sessions
Strengths: Strong engagement with EMDR process, good emotional regulation capacity
Treatment goals: Reduce intrusive symptoms, resume normal driving, decrease hypervigilance
Goals addressed: Processing traumatic memory through EMDR

Plan:
- Continue weekly sessions in person
- Next session: March 19, 2026
- Focus: Continue EMDR processing of remaining target memories
- No referrals needed at this time
- Level of care: Outpatient
- Discharge planning: Not planned
test_type: Trauma/EMDR in-person, PTSD diagnosis, moderate severity
